message.content:
cs.CR, cs.DB, cs.LG, cs.DS, cs.IT 

This paper discusses the challenges of releasing private data while protecting privacy, which is a common topic in the field of computer security (cs.CR). The paper also proposes a novel mechanism for differential privacy, which involves manipulating probability distributions, making it relevant to the sub-category of databases (cs.DB) and machine learning (cs.LG). The paper also involves theoretical analysis and simulations, which are common in the sub-categories of data structures and algorithms (cs.DS) and information theory (cs.IT).
